==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=uc|rs=竹03}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|on=[[う]] (u)
|kun=[[ふえ]] (fue)
}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=う}} {{m|ltc|竽|tr=*hju}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|竽|tr=yú}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɯᵝ]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|う}}

# a [[woodwind]] instrument introduced to Japan from China during the [[w:Nara period|Nara period]], similar to a {{m|ja|笙|tr=shō||a kind of free-reed woodwind instrument}}, but larger and one octave lower in [[pitch]]
#: This instrument fell out of use for {{m|ja|雅楽|tr=gagaku||court music}} in the mid-[[w:Heian period|Heian period]], and was later reconstructed after World War II based in part on artifacts at the [[w:Shōsōin|Shōsōin]].

====Idioms====
* {{ja-r|竽を好むに瑟を鼓す|う を このむ に しつ を こす}}: “to play a bass koto to someone who likes the ''u''” → to do something that doesn't [[suit]] a person's [[taste]]s or [[preference]]s
